data.name: Piper Down
data.description:
A Scottish ale with San Diego spirit.
Our Piper Down Scottish Ale hits all the right notes for the Ballast Point Bagpipe Corps that inspired it. We created this very low hopped, malty ale for the band to enjoy using UK Maris Otter malt, roasted barley, UK hops and low fermentation temperatures. Then we let the brew’s sweet complexity build over a three-hour boil. Full of roasted caramel flavor, it’s a pub classic with Ballast Point personality.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Scottish-Style Light Ale
style.description: Scottish light ales are light bodied. Little bitterness is perceived, and hop flavor or aroma should not be perceived. Despite its lightness, Scottish light ale will have a degree of malty, caramel-like, soft and chewy character. Yeast characters such as diacetyl (butterscotch) and sulfuriness are acceptable at very low levels. The color will range from golden amber to deep brown Bottled versions of this traditional draft beer may contain higher amounts of carbon dioxide than is typical for mildly carbonated draft versions. Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures. Though there is little evidence suggesting that traditionally made Scottishstyle light ales exhibited peat smoke character, the current marketplace offers many Scottish-style light ales with peat or smoke character present at low to medium levels. Thus a peaty/smoky character may be evident at low levels (ales with medium or higher smoke character would be considered a smoke flavored beer and considered in another category). Scottish-style light ales may be split into two subcategories: Traditional (no smoke character) and Peated (low level of peat smoke character).

breweries.name: Ballast Point Brewing Company
breweries.description: Ballast Point Brewing Company is one of San Diego's Premiere Breweries. We started out modestly as Home Brew Mart in 1992. Our goal was to teach others how to brew quality handcrafted beer at home. In 1996 the brewery was installed by New World Brewing Systems in the space behind our retail store and production began in September. In May of 2005 we open our second brewery in Scripps Ranch.  We currently distribute five of our favorite beers, Yellowtail Pale Ale,  Calico Amber Ale , Big Eye I.P.A., Black Marlin Porter and Wahoo Wheat Beer to a thirsty San Diego.  Come to our brewery and we will gladly give you a tour and allow you to sample our newest selection of beers. Currently our beer is available in twelve ounce bottles to 15.5 gallon kegs. We also offer half gallon and gallon glass jugs to go. Kegs are available for rent to the public with a minimum deposit.  The name for our brewery comes from the point where Juan Rodriguez Cabrillo first set foot in California. Located on the Point Loma Peninsula, Ballast Point is considered the gateway to San Diego Harbor. Stones from this area were used as ballast in the cargo holds of sailing ships returning to the eastern seaboard. Many New England streets are still lined with the cobblestones brought back from San Diego.

data.name: Rare Oak Pale Ale
data.description: This refreshing pale ale has been matured over rare Scottish oak and then finished with the addition of Sweet Gale, which grows wild in the Highlands of Scotland and was used traditionally as an alternative to imported hops. Crisp, fragrant and light, this beer is one for long summer evenings.

breweries.name: Innis & Gunn
breweries.description:
Innis & Gunn is a specialist independent brewing company based in Edinburgh, Scotland. Established in 2003, its beer has gone on to be the most popular British bottled beer sold in Canada, and second most popular in Sweden. It was part of the nominated drinks list for the G8 Summit 2005 at Gleneagles Hotel.

The business is, since 2008, family owned following a management buy-out from its original part-owners, William Grant and Sons.

Their Innis & Gunn Original beer is brewed in Dunbar, East Lothian before being matured in American white oak Bourbon barrels for 30 days and is then a further 47 days in a marrying tun, and so it is matured for 77 days in total. It is 6.6% alcohol by volume. At first only available as a bottled beer it is now marketed both in bottles and as draught.

According to Innis and Gunn's website, the process was discovered in an ironic accident: the intent was to create a scotch whisky with ale flavours. To do this, a special beer was created which would then be stored in the whisky barrels. After the beer had conditioned the barrels, it was to be discarded and replaced with the whisky. The brewers noted that the process had an agreeable effect on the beer, and thus aging the beer became an end in itself.

A "blonde" version of Innis & Gunn is also widely available, and a limited edition matured in rum barrels was produced.

data.name: SB-X4 60 SCHILLING
data.description: Classic Scottish style ale served on Nitrogen gas. A light sipping beer with a creamy head and body.

breweries.name: Schubros Brewery
breweries.description:
Create great craft beer and build experiences surpassing the ordinary through education, responsible community interaction, and sustainable business practices

The craft-connoisseur's utopia. Flawless representation of the most influential styles. Plus a full portfolio of permanent, perennials, and limited editions that ever-explore our globe's limitless range of brew styles and accents. 

So set aside any preconceived notions about beer, and Raze Expectations!

data.name: Scotch Ale
data.description: A dark beer brewed in the tradition of a strong Scotch ale. Sweet and strong, made with a traditional Scottish ale yeast, this hardy brew will make ya see plaid.

breweries.name: Empire Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Empire Brewing Company began as a contemporary Microbrewery & Restaurant in Syracuse, New York. Established in 1994, we have served our national & international award winning ales & lagers exclusively to the craft beer pallets of Central New York.
In 2010, we expanded our proprietary brewing practice to Brooklyn, NY. We are excited to offer you the fruits of our labor in a pint glass. Thank you for your patronage & please enjoy responsibly.

Cheers!
empire brewing company

breweries.name: St. Boniface Craft Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saint Boniface Craft Brewing Co is a nano-brewery located in Ephrata, Pa. After years of brewing and competing with each other for kudos in their local community, Mike Price and Jon Northup decided to join forces and produce the best beer that we—using our combined brewing experience—could produce.

Saint Boniface is the name of the patron saint of brewers, the saint also associated with converting Germany to Christianity. St. Boniface saw the unconverted Saxons worshiping Thor and knew something must be done. The humble saint took an axe to the massive Thor Oak, which was sacred to the Saxons, in order to show them that his God was mightier than theirs. With fierce and repeated blows he leveled the massive tree; those around him feared God and were converted to Christianity.

The deed of Boniface provides an elegant analogy for our own mission at Saint Boniface Craft Brewing Co. Mike and Jon have witnessed many beer “pagans” worshiping the false gods of the big beer industry and see that it is time to take a Boniface-like swing at converting some of those people to a better way of life, one full of rich, tasty, more satisfying brews.

data.name: Scottish 70 Schilling
data.description: This traditional Scottish ale gained its unique name during the 1800's when it was referred to the price of ale per barrel. The Scottish 70 is our lightest beer at Blue Stallion Brewing Co and would have cost 70 shillings back in the mid 19th century, hence the name “70 Shilling”. We only use a small amount of British hops in this beer, so it has a distinct malty sweetness as well as a slight caramel taste. This particular beer has a deep amber color and gives off a light and fruity aroma. This beer is fermented at slightly cooler temperatures to simulate the typical Scottish brewing techniques.

breweries.name: Blue Stallion Brewing Company
breweries.description: Blue Stallion Brewing Co. is the newest craft brewery in Lexington, Kentucky. We make the finest German lagers and British Ales focusing on traditional brewing techniques and ingredients. We want to bring Lexington an experience in beer not available anywhere else.

data.name: Scottish Ale
data.description: Our Scottish Ale is loaded with a clean malt flavor layered throughout the beer. We created this beer to be malt forward, yet sessionable.    East Kent Golding hops are used to balance but not overpower the malt profile. Big enough to comfort that malt craving, yet very smooth and balanced.  Enjoy!e.

breweries.name: Saint Archer Brewing Company
breweries.description: Saint Archer Brewing Company was founded on a unique strain of creative talent: World-class brewers. Artists and musicians. Surfers, skateboarders, and snowboarders…. All coming together with passion and commitment to express our collective true love — handcrafted beer. Saint Archer's been a long time in the tank and we hope you taste our appreciation and gratitude in every sip.

breweries.name: Brigadoon Brewery & Brew School
breweries.description:
Brigadoon Brewery & Brew School is a unique seasonal brewpub and teaching facility located on the grounds of the Texas Renaissance Festival in Plantersville, Texas. To our knowledge we are the only functioning brewpub located on the grounds of a renaissance festival brewing using both period specific equipment and modern equipment to brew hand crafted ale and then serving it back to the public.

What does that actually mean? Well eight weekends a year we don our garb and brew beer using equipment, ingredients, techniques and recipes that would have been available during the 1400's through the 1600's. We then give samples of ale away and sell pints to visitors that pass through our booth allowing them the opportunity to taste a piece of living history. To our knowledge we are the only renaissance style brewery or brewpub operating at a Renaissance Festival using period recipes, equipement and methods to brew ale and then serving it back to the public.

We also have seasonal beers that will make their debut throughout the year.The preliminary restaurant to sample our product would be the Riverside, CA location which is where we brew our fine product.

data.name: Scottish Ale
data.description: It takes a brave beer to stand up to a Maine winter. Gritty McDuff 's Scottish Ale is returns every January to help you weather the season. Scottish Style Ale is our interpretation of the robust brews native to Scotland. Generous quantities of Pale malt along with Munich and Caramalts give this ale a deep and complex profile. Scottish Style Ale is just a shade darker than our Bitter, with a rich, slightly sweet first impression on the palate that rounds out to a satisfying maltiness and a medium-dry hop finish. At 6.3% ABV it's hearty but not overwhelming. Sure to please the Braveheart in all of us.

breweries.name: Gritty McDuff's Brewing Company
breweries.description: Established in 1988 as Maine's Original Brewpub-the first to open it's doors in the state of Maine since prohibition-Gritty's has been at the forefront of Maine's leading craft beer industry introducing fresh English ales either on tap or on cask everyday for the last 20+ years! With the long wooden tables and cobblestone streets, the ambiance matches those of the hometown pubs in England and the people are just as merry! Come in for a pint, leave a fan for life. Gritty's...for what ales ya!

data.name: Scottish Ale
data.description: A caramel sweet beer with a malty profile. This amber toned beer has low but apparent hops. Small hints of smokiness may be found throughout this well balanced brew.

breweries.name: Stone Cellar Brewpub & Restaurant
breweries.description:
1989 was the year this particular brewery was established. At the time, it was Wisconsin’s third Brewpub. Since that time #1 and #2 have vanished leaving Stone Cellar Brewpub the oldest, continually running Brewpub in the state of Wisconsin. All this in a building built 151 years ago to house a brewery!

We brew in 7 barrel (217 gallon) batches on an old, yet reliable brewhouse and can produce up to 1,000 barrels per year. We also have a small bottling line which allows us to sell bottles of our beers right from our bar.

Stone Cellar beer to go!
6 packs and growlers of Stone Cellar beer can be purchased in our bar area to enjoy at home!

breweries.name: Highlander Brew Co
breweries.description: Highlander Brew Co. is located in South River, in the Almaguin Highlands of Ontario. The brewery is on the Northern edge of Algonquin Park, making Highlander the most northerly craft brewery in Ontario.

data.name: Scottish Ale
data.description: Malty and hoppy, we at Belhaven love the classic Scottish Ale and we've been brewing it longer than any of the other beers we produce. Delivering a sweet, smooth and creamy finish, Scottish Ale has a stunning ruby colour in the glass. Magic.

data.name: Scottish Ale
data.description: Our take on a traditional Scottish Ale is brewed slightly stronger than normal. Medium body with a smooth mellow toffee sweetness, low bitterness and minimal hop aroma and flavor let our clean American malted barley shine. Scottish Ales get their sweetness not from crystal malt like many beers, but with large additions of 2-row malt and very small amounts of specialty malts.

breweries.name: 7th Settlement Brewery
breweries.description: A Community Supported Brewery (CSB) in Dover, NH. Specializing in high quality, hand crafted ales and lagers.  Enjoy a paring of our great beers with our amazing locally sourced progressive American pub fair!

data.name: Scottish Ale
data.description: Our flagship beer and Gold Medal Winner at the 2014 World Beer Cup.  A rich, full flavored ale with great body.  Deep amber hues accent this smooth delicious beer. Lightly hopped, as this one is all about the malt and finishes with delicate carmel and smokey undertones.

style.description: Scottish light ales are light bodied. Little bitterness is perceived, and hop flavor or aroma should not be perceived. Despite its lightness, Scottish light ale will have a degree of malty, caramel-like, soft and chewy character. Yeast characters such as diacetyl (butterscotch) and sulfuriness are acceptable at very low levels. The color will range from golden amber to deep brown Bottled versions of this traditional draft beer may contain higher amounts of carbon dioxide than is typical for mildly carbonated draft versions. Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures. Though there is little evidence suggesting that traditionally made Scottishstyle light ales exhibited peat smoke character, the current marketplace offers many Scottish-style light ales with peat or smoke character present at low to medium levels. Thus a peaty/smoky character may be evident at low levels (ales with medium or higher smoke character would be considered a smoke flavored beer and considered in another category). Scottish-style light ales may be split into two subcategories: Traditional (no smoke character) and Peated (low level of peat smoke character).

breweries.name: Two Kilts Brewing Co
breweries.description: Two Kilts Brewing Co. was founded in 2009 by owners and brewers Chris Dillon, and Alex McGaw.  Fueled by a passion for all things craft beer they opened a modest 6  barrel brewery and in 2 short years have expanded to their current 15 barrel brewery. They specialize in hand crafting fine American Ales and Lagers, brewed with hints of European influence.

data.name: Scottish Ale
data.description: A traditional scottish ale with malty sweetness and a slight peaty (smoky) aroma.  Small amounts of roasted barley lend a dry, slightly roasty finish.

style.name: Scottish-Style Light Ale

breweries.name: High Desert Brewing Co.
breweries.description: After years of recipe development, remodeling, and parking lot paving, the High Desert Brewing Co. opened it's doors in July of 1997 and has quickly become one of New Mexico's premier brewpubs. Our selection of hand crafted lagers and ales are produced on premises using the finest grains and hops. We brew small batches of about 100 gallons, ensuring that each beer is served at the peak of freshness. Our brews are available by the glass, pint, or pitcher and to-go in 1/2 gallon growlers and 5 gallon kegs. We make every attempt to keep all of our beers on tap at all times but once in a while one or two may not be available for a few days. These times are the perfect opportunity to stretch your taste and try something other than your favorite. Please let Bob or Donna, or any of the High Desert Brewing Co. staff know how you think we are doing.

breweries.name: Manitou Brewing Company
breweries.description: MBC offers a wide variety of beer styles brewed on location and also craft beer from our favorite breweries around the world. While we offer a few flagship brews year round, our tap selection generally varies from week to week, and of course season to season. If you don’t see your favorite style, stop by and let us know what YOU would like to see us brew…If you ask for it, we will brew it!

breweries.name: Central Waters Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Brewing since 1998, Central Waters Brewing Company is built on the solid reputation of producing the finest quality beer in Central Wisconsin: Ouisconsing Red Ale, Happy Heron Pale Ale, Mudpuppy Porter, and many more.

Currently, Central Waters Brewing Company services over 200 retail locations in Central Wisconsin, and has expanded its product line to include 18 beer styles. Moving from Junction City to a new facility in Amherst, Wisconsin in January of 2007, Central Waters can better support the growing demand. CWBC continues to build on the solid reputation of producing the finest quality beers in Central Wisconsin.

data.name: Slide
data.description: This sessionable scotch ale features the familiar notes of caramelized malts and subtle sweetness that define the style, threaded with complex undertones to create a blanket of rich flavor. Drop a couple cans in the snow for a cold pour that’ll warm your palate and your bones.

style.name: Scottish-Style Light Ale
style.description: Scottish light ales are light bodied. Little bitterness is perceived, and hop flavor or aroma should not be perceived. Despite its lightness, Scottish light ale will have a degree of malty, caramel-like, soft and chewy character. Yeast characters such as diacetyl (butterscotch) and sulfuriness are acceptable at very low levels. The color will range from golden amber to deep brown Bottled versions of this traditional draft beer may contain higher amounts of carbon dioxide than is typical for mildly carbonated draft versions. Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures. Though there is little evidence suggesting that traditionally made Scottishstyle light ales exhibited peat smoke character, the current marketplace offers many Scottish-style light ales with peat or smoke character present at low to medium levels. breweries.name: Brothers Craft Brewing
breweries.description:
Harrisonburg, VA is and always has been our home, so where better to open a brewery than in our own backyard? Well, maybe our taproom/brewing facility isn’t literally in our backyard – in fact we renovated a soda bottling plant to suit all of our production needs – but with such a close-knit and supportive community, every inch of Virginia feels like home.

Brothers Craft Brewing (originally Three Brothers Brewing) was founded by the three Shifflett siblings, who used their collective experience to execute a singular vision: brew exciting, unique craft beers that emphasize and support our community.

It didn’t take long to realize that same community was our extended family. The three of us may be related by blood, but our staff, our customers, and our collaborators have all become brothers.

When thinking about the people we’ve surrounded ourselves with and making sure we had the ability to continue to grow, we made the bold decision to rebrand our business as Brothers Craft Brewing.

Despite the challenges associated with such a change, we feel that our new name truly represents our evolution as a business. Why limit our brotherhood to three when we’ve gained so much family already?

When we started this endeavor, we couldn’t have possibly imagined the growth we’ve been so fortunate to experience. Since beginning production in December of 2012, we’ve had the honor of taking home various awards, expanding our production facilities and distribution, but most importantly we’ve been able to share our passion for meticulously crafted, delicious beer with each of our fans.

So thank you all for everything you’ve done for us. Thank you for keeping our dream alive.

Cheers!

data.name: Springtime Ale
data.description: A fine wee ale in th’ scots tradition. Rich malty flaver be our brewer’s mission. Sweit aroma frae flowerin’ heather. Springtime in Scotland ne’er bin better!

breweries.name: Mt. Carmel Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Mt. Carmel Brewing Company is a local family owned and operated brewery. The brewery was founded in May of 2005 by Cincinnati natives Mike and Kathleen Dewey. 

Inspired with a passion for good beer, founders Mike and Kathleen Dewey work towards providing exceptional craft beers to the greater Cincinnati area. We look forward to serving our customers, as if each was our first and only. We look to grow at a comfortable pace not to jeopardize our focus on product quality, customer service, and a respectful business practice.

data.name: St. Marty’s Choice
data.description: St. Marty’s Choice is a Scotch Ale with caramel  malt notes and a tawny hue. This ale is brewed in honor of our number one mug clubber Marty Price. St. Marty’s is single hopped, using exclusively Goldings.  The alcohol content is 7.3% . Ask for a pint of St. Marty’s Choice, it’s guaranteed to be a heavenly experience.

breweries.name: Snake River Brewing
breweries.description:
America's most award-winning small brewery since 1994 offering a wide array of lagers and ales with hand-crafted cuisine. Locals and tourists alike co-mingle in a friendly and casual environment.

Make yourself at home at Snake River Brewing in the heart of the Teton Mountain Range. All roads, trails, bike paths, climbing routes and ski runs lead to “The Brewpub”! After a day in the great outdoors how can you not partake of a tasty malt beverage and a delicious meal

data.name: Tally Wacker
data.description:
A mild, malt-forward, food-friendly, copper-colored ale with a hint of toasted caramel up front, a slightly peaty character and just a dash of fresh, grassy hops for balance.

Tally Wacker Scottish Ale is a year-round specialty beer available exclusively for draft accounts. This classic crowd-pleasing Scottish ale is available under the Tally Wacker name or can be purchased as a branded signature tap selection.
data.foodPairings: Moderately sharp or earthy cheeses, roast beef, baked ham, sweet potato and caramelized onion frittata, mellow roasted garlic.

breweries.name: Arbor Brewing Company
breweries.description: Our love affair with beer began in 1991 with our first batch of homebrew. Eventually the brewing operation took over the kitchen and basement and we decided it was time to look for larger digs. So with the help of family and friends, we opened the ABC Brewpub a brewery and restaurant in Ann Arbor, Michigan in 1995.

breweries.name: Old Nation Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Old Nation Brewing is the culmination of years of hard work for brewer Travis Fritts. He spent time in Germany honing his craft under the best brewers in the world and returned to the states with master brewing credentials. He wanted to return to the place he grew up to spread his knowledge and love of great beer. And 
Williamston is the perfect fit.

And don't worry, the food will be taken just as seriously as the beer. Because a good pub should be a fusion of incredible beer, food, and people.

data.name: The King's Taxes
data.description: The King’s Taxes 60 Schilling bridges between old and new interpretations of Scottish ales. The recipe uses a decent amount of proper cane sugar-based invert sugar syrup, equivalent to Brewer’s No. 2 invert. It lends a clean maple syrup to caramel-sweet note, not achievable with beet sugar inverts (i.e. Belgian candi sugar). Inspite of this one old-timey ingredient, an extended boil is avoided by using dark specialty malts for color and a bit of toastiness to keep the invert flavor in check. Hopping is minimal; this beer is all about the flavors gleaned from the malt and sugar.

breweries.name: Boylan Bridge Brewpub
breweries.description:
The Boylan Bridge Brewpub has a bright and open atmosphere conducive to conversation, business, and social interaction. The architectural millwork and cabinetwork built downstairs in the shop has made the Bridge a beautiful, durable facility using fine woods, ceramic tile, and canvas covered tackboard on the walls.

The brewing operation is visible from the bar through glass doors, offering an industrial connection with stainless steel tanks and copper piping throughout.

The most popular feature of the place is the outdoor deck. It offers an expansive view of the downtown Raleigh skyline. A wood post and beam pergola structure enclose the space and provides mottled shade without trapping sound, making conversation easy.

data.description: Dark amber Scotch Ale with notes of sweet caramel and fruit esters.

breweries.name: Triple Rock Brewery and Alehouse
breweries.description:
Even as one of the oldest brewpubs in the country, Triple Rock is all about keeping things fresh. Fresh craft beer served along fresh food, with menus and specials changing and updating all the time. On any two consecutive days here you will likely find something new and different to try, or you’re welcome to stick with your favorites (those will be fresh too). 

That’s one of the advantages of Triple Rock, where you can watch our brewers make the beer and know that you’ll be drinking it as soon as its done—no kegging, no bottling necessary, just straight from the tanks to your glass. Also, with 11 serving tanks and 8 fermenters on the premises, we can always keep something fresh on our beer board. Do you feel yourself getting thirsty?

breweries.name: Brothers Craft Brewing
breweries.description:
Harrisonburg, VA is and always has been our home, so where better to open a brewery than in our own backyard? Well, maybe our taproom/brewing facility isn’t literally in our backyard – in fact we renovated a soda bottling plant to suit all of our production needs – but with such a close-knit and supportive community, every inch of Virginia feels like home.

Brothers Craft Brewing (originally Three Brothers Brewing) was founded by the three Shifflett siblings, who used their collective experience to execute a singular vision: brew exciting, unique craft beers that emphasize and support our community.

It didn’t take long to realize that same community was our extended family. The three of us may be related by blood, but our staff, our customers, and our collaborators have all become brothers.

When thinking about the people we’ve surrounded ourselves with and making sure we had the ability to continue to grow, we made the bold decision to rebrand our business as Brothers Craft Brewing.

Despite the challenges associated with such a change, we feel that our new name truly represents our evolution as a business. Why limit our brotherhood to three when we’ve gained so much family already?

When we started this endeavor, we couldn’t have possibly imagined the growth we’ve been so fortunate to experience. Since beginning production in December of 2012, we’ve had the honor of taking home various awards, expanding our production facilities and distribution, but most importantly we’ve been able to share our passion for meticulously crafted, delicious beer with each of our fans.

So thank you all for everything you’ve done for us. Thank you for keeping our dream alive.

Cheers!

Huske Hardware is proudly brewing 6 unique Custom Craft Beers - never filtered and always using the highest quality import and domestic malts and hops.

breweries.name: Lexington Brewing Company and Wine House
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Lexington Brewing Company and Wine House
breweries.description:
Think Globally, Drink Locally

Located in historic Lexington, MI the winery offers many award winning wines AND CRAFT BEER for samples, by the glass, and by the bottle. Wine makers Connie Currie and Steven Velloff have created a warm and inviting atmosphere  "Where the past meets the present and good friends come to meet."

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm
Fri: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pm
Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm
Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

style.name: Scottish-Style Light Ale
style.description: Scottish light ales are light bodied. Little bitterness is perceived, and hop flavor or aroma should not be perceived. Despite its lightness, Scottish light ale will have a degree of malty, caramel-like, soft and chewy character. Yeast characters such as diacetyl (butterscotch) and sulfuriness are acceptable at very low levels. The color will range from golden amber to deep brown Bottled versions of this traditional draft beer may contain higher amounts of carbon dioxide than is typical for mildly carbonated draft versions. Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures. Though there is little evidence suggesting that traditionally made Scottishstyle light ales exhibited peat smoke character, the current marketplace offers many Scottish-style light ales with peat or smoke character present at low to medium levels. Thus a peaty/smoky character may be evident at low levels (ales with medium or higher smoke character would be considered a smoke flavored beer and considered in another category). Scottish-style light ales may be split into two subcategories: Traditional (no smoke character) and Peated (low level of peat smoke character).

breweries.name: Utah Brewers Cooperative
breweries.description:
Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee, America’s beer capital, only to discover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

In fact, it was Schirf who proposed the bill to the Utah Legislature in 1988 that would make brew pubs legal in Utah. There are now more than 12 thriving brew pubs in the state thanks to Schirf and the bill's sponsor, Senator Mike Demeitrick of Price, Utah.

data.name: Williams 80/-
data.description: The Brotherhood's 'Eighty Bob' is a rich mahogany ale, with malt and butter aroma, biscuit texture, and a clean, satisfyingly sweet finish. The hops take a back seat on this ride.

breweries.name: Williams Brothers Brewing Company
breweries.description: Scottish Craft Beer - Microbrewed For Maximum Flavour. A brotherhood of brewers, creating unique beers while enjoying life beyond the mash tun. Creating & selling exciting new & historical brews worldwide.
